info.title: Klavis AI (https://www.klavis.ai)
info.description: Klavis AI - Open Source MCP Integrations for AI Applications

post.description:
Calls a tool on a specific remote MCP server, used for function calling. Eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation.
Under the hood, Klavis will instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection with the remote MCP server to call the tool.

Lists all tools available for a specific remote MCP server in various AI model formats.

This eliminates the need for manual MCP code implementation and format conversion.
Under the hood, Klavis instantiates an MCP client and establishes a connection 
with the remote MCP server to retrieve available tools.

Create a Strata MCP server.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

Add servers to an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After adding servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated with the new servers.

Parameters:
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to add all available servers, a list of specific server names, or null to add no servers
- externalServers: Optional list of external MCP servers to validate and add

delete.description:
Delete servers from an existing Strata MCP server.

Note: After deleting servers, you need to reconnect the MCP server so that list_tool can be updated to reflect the removed servers.

Parameters:
- strataId: The strata server ID (path parameter)
- servers: Can be 'ALL' to delete all available Klavis integration, a list of specific server names, or null to delete no servers
- externalServers: Query parameter - comma-separated list of external server names to delete

Returns separate lists for deleted Klavis servers and deleted external servers.

parameters.name: servers

schema.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.
schema.title: Servers

parameters.description: List of Klavis integration to delete (e.g., 'jira', 'linear'), 'ALL' to delete all Klavis integration, or null to delete no servers.

parameters.name: externalServers

schema.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete
schema.title: Externalservers

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of external server names to delete

get.description:
Get information about an existing Strata MCP server instance.

Returns the strata URL, connected klavis servers, connected external servers (with URLs), 
and authentication URLs for klavis servers.
Fetch raw actions (all underlying actions) for a specific integration within a Strata MCP instance.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific integration within a Strata MCP server.

Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.

Creates a URL for a specified MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
Returns the existing server URL if it already exists for the user.
If OAuth is configured for the server, also returns the base OAuth authorization URL.
Note that some servers have hundreds of tools and therefore only expose the Strata tools.

Creates an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server,
validating the request with an API key and user details.
The main purpose of this endpoint is to create an instance id for a self-hosted MCP server.
The instance id is used to identify and store the auth metadata in the database.
Returns the existing instance id if it already exists for the user.

get.description:
Checks the details of a specific server connection instance using its unique ID and API key,
returning server details like authentication status and associated server/platform info.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance whose status is being checked. This is returned by the Create API.

patch.description:
Updates the settings of a specific server connection instance.
Currently supports updating the read-only status of the connection.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to update.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to update.

delete.description:
Completely removes a server connection instance using its unique ID,
deleting all associated data from the system.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete.

schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection instance to delete auth for.

get.description:
Retrieves the auth data for a specific integration instance that the API key owner controls.
Includes access token, refresh token, and other authentication data.

This endpoint includes proper ownership verification to ensure users can only access
authentication data for integration instances they own. It also handles token refresh if needed.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to get auth data for.
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The ID of the connection integration instance to get auth data for.

get.description: Get tools information for any MCP server.

parameters.name: serverName

schema.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

parameters.name: format

schema.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

parameters.description: The format to return tools in. Default is MCP Native format for maximum compatibility.

parameters.name: legacy

schema.description: Whether to use the legacy server. Default is False.
schema.title: Legacy

parameters.description: Whether to use the legacy server. Default is False.

get.description: Get all MCP servers with their basic information including id, name, description, and tools.

post.description:
Sets authentication data for a specific integration instance.
Accepts either API key authentication or general authentication data.
This updates the auth_metadata for the specified integration instance.

get.description:
Fetch raw actions (all underlying actions) for a specific integration instance.

This endpoint takes an instance ID, and then fetches the raw actions with categories.

parameters.name: instanceId

schema.description: The instance ID for the server connection
schema.title: Instanceid

parameters.description: The instance ID for the server connection

Users cannot delete their own accounts.

test_account_email.title: Test Account Email
test_account_email.description: Optional email of a specific test account to acquire. If provided, the system will attempt to acquire the sandbox associated with this test account email instead of a random idle sandbox.

AcquireSandboxRequest.title: AcquireSandboxRequest
AcquireSandboxRequest.description: Request model for acquiring a sandbox

tables.title: Tables
tables.description: List of tables (simplified, assumes single base)

AirtableData-Input.title: AirtableData
AirtableData-Input.description:
Complete Airtable sandbox data structure.

Hierarchy:
- Bases contain Tables
- Tables contain Fields (schema) and Records (data)
- Records contain field values

Note: For sandbox purposes, we typically work with a single base
and multiple tables within it.

type.title: Type
type.description: Field type (singleLineText, multilineText, number, singleSelect, multipleSelects, date, checkbox, url, email, phoneNumber, attachment, etc.)

options.title: Options
options.description: Field options (e.g., choices for select fields)

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Dictionary of field names to values

AirtableRecord.title: AirtableRecord
AirtableRecord.description: Airtable Record object (a row in a table)

token.title: Token
token.description: The API key to save (token field)

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: The API key to save (api_key field)

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: List of projects with nested tasks and stories

AsanaData-Input.title: AsanaData
AsanaData-Input.description:
Complete Asana sandbox data structure.

Nested hierarchy for initialization:
- Projects contain Tasks
- Tasks contain Stories (comments)

AsanaStory.title: AsanaStory
AsanaStory.description: Asana Story object (comment on a task)

gid.title: Gid
gid.description: Globally unique identifier of the resource (read-only, set by Asana)

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message from the OAuth process

data.title: Data
data.description: Additional data related to the response

type.title: Type
type.description: Field type (STRING, INTEGER, FLOAT, BOOLEAN, TIMESTAMP, RECORD, etc.)

BigQueryField-Input.title: BigQueryField
BigQueryField-Input.description: Schema field for a BigQuery table

type.title: Type
type.description: Field type (STRING, INTEGER, FLOAT, BOOLEAN, TIMESTAMP, RECORD, etc.)

BigQueryField-Output.title: BigQueryField
BigQueryField-Output.description: Schema field for a BigQuery table

isDefault.title: Isdefault
isDefault.description: Whether this is the default schedule

CalcomSchedule.title: CalcomSchedule
CalcomSchedule.description:
Schedule data for creating a new schedule via Cal.com API.

Attributes:
    name: Human-readable schedule name
    timeZone: IANA timezone (e.g., "America/New_York")
    isDefault: Whether this is the default schedule for the user
    availability: List of recurring time slots (optional, defaults to Mon-Fri 9-17)
    overrides: List of date-specific availability overrides (optional)

serverUrl.title: Serverurl
serverUrl.description: The full URL for connecting to the MCP server

toolName.title: Toolname
toolName.description: The name of the tool to call

toolArgs.title: Toolargs
toolArgs.description: The input parameters for the tool

connectionType.description: The connection type to use for the MCP server. Default is STREAMABLE_HTTP.

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to include when connecting to the server

success.title: Success
success.description: Whether the API call was successful

result.description: The result of the tool call, if successful

error.title: Error
error.description: Error message, if the tool call failed

content.title: Content
content.description: The content of the tool call

isError.title: Iserror
isError.description: Whether the tool call was successful

CallToolResult.title: CallToolResult
CallToolResult.description: The server's response to a tool call.

spaces.title: Spaces
spaces.description: List of spaces with nested objects

ClickUpData-Input.title: ClickUpData
ClickUpData-Input.description:
Complete ClickUp sandbox data structure.

Nested hierarchy for initialization:
- Spaces contain Folders and Lists (folderless)
- Folders contain Lists
- Lists contain Tasks
- Tasks contain Comments

CloseContact.title: CloseContact
CloseContact.description: Close Contact object - child of Lead

leads.title: Leads
leads.description: List of leads with nested objects

CloseData-Input.title: CloseData
CloseData-Input.description:
Complete Close sandbox data structure.

Nested hierarchy for initialization:
- Leads contain Contacts, Opportunities, and Tasks

CloseLead.title: CloseLead
CloseLead.description: Close Lead object - parent object containing contacts, opportunities, and tasks

CloseOpportunity.title: CloseOpportunity
CloseOpportunity.description: Close Opportunity object - child of Lead

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when the task is actionable

CloseTask.title: CloseTask
CloseTask.description: Close Task object - child of Lead

ConfluenceData-Input.title: ConfluenceData
ConfluenceData-Input.description:
Complete Confluence sandbox data structure.

Hierarchy:
- Spaces contain Pages
- Pages can have children (nested pages) and Comments

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.description: Individual person associated with an account

sandbox_id.title: Sandbox Id
sandbox_id.description: Unique identifier for the acquired sandbox

server_url.title: Server Url
server_url.description: URL to connect to the MCP server

serverName.description: The name of the target MCP server. Case-insensitive (e.g., 'google calendar', 'GOOGLE_CALENDAR', 'Google Calendar' are all valid).

userId.title: Userid
userId.description: The unique identifier for the user. The server instance along with the all the authentication data will belong to that specific user only. It can be a UUID from the database, a unique email address from the user, etc.

instanceId.title: Instanceid
instanceId.description: The unique identifier for this specific server connection integration instance.

oauthUrl.title: Oauthurl
oauthUrl.description: The OAuth authorization URL for the specified server, if OAuth is configured.

Moneybird contact (customer/supplier) - API format

    firstname: First name (optional, for individual contacts)
    lastname: Last name (optional, for individual contacts)
    phone: Phone number
    address1: Street address
    city: City
    zipcode: Postal code
    country: Country code (e.g., 'NL', 'DE', 'FR')
    sepa_iban: SEPA IBAN for direct debit (optional)

MoneybirdData-Input.title: MoneybirdData
MoneybirdData-Input.description:
Complete Moneybird sandbox data structure - API format

Note: Objects are created in dependency order:
1. Ledger accounts (no dependencies)
2. Contacts (no dependencies)
3. Products (no dependencies, but needs tax rates from system)
4. Projects (no dependencies)
5. Time entries (linked to projects and contacts)
6. Sales invoices (linked to contacts)

ledger_accounts.title: Ledger Accounts
ledger_accounts.description: List of ledger accounts to create

Complete Moneybird sandbox data structure - API format

1. Ledger accounts (no dependencies)
2. Contacts (no dependencies)
3. Products (no dependencies, but needs tax rates from system)
4. Projects (no dependencies)
5. Time entries (linked to projects and contacts)
6. Sales invoices (linked to contacts)

rgs_code.description: RGS code - required for creation, not returned by GET API

MoneybirdLedgerAccount.description:
Moneybird ledger account (chart of accounts) - API format

Attributes:
    rgs_code: Reference Grootboekschema (RGS) code - required for creation
    name: Account name
    account_type: Account type (revenue, expense, etc.)
    account_id: Account identifier (optional, system accounts may not have this)

MoneybirdProduct.title: MoneybirdProduct
MoneybirdProduct.description:
Moneybird product/service - API format

Attributes:
    description: Product description
    title: Product title/name
    price: Product price
    currency: Currency code (e.g., 'EUR')
    identifier: Product SKU/identifier
    frequency: Billing frequency (optional, for recurring products)
    frequency_type: Frequency type (e.g., 'month', 'year')

MoneybirdProject.title: MoneybirdProject
MoneybirdProject.description:
Moneybird project for time tracking and invoicing - API format

Attributes:
    name: Project name
    state: Project state (active, archived)
    budget: Project budget

MoneybirdSalesInvoice.title: MoneybirdSalesInvoice
MoneybirdSalesInvoice.description:
Moneybird sales invoice - API format

Note: During initialization, contact_id will be automatically assigned based on
the contacts created. Invoice dates will be calculated dynamically.

Attributes:
    reference: Invoice reference number
    currency: Currency code (e.g., 'EUR')
    prices_are_incl_tax: Whether prices include tax
    state: Invoice state (draft, open, paid)
    details: List of invoice line items

MoneybirdTimeEntry.title: MoneybirdTimeEntry
MoneybirdTimeEntry.description:
Moneybird time entry - API format

Note: During initialization, this will be linked to a project and contact automatically.
The started_at and ended_at timestamps will be generated based on the hours field.

Attributes:
    description: Description of work performed
    hours: Number of hours worked
    billable: Whether this time is billable

- Data Sources contain Pages (with properties matching the schema)
- Standalone Pages exist at top level (not in databases)

- Pages refer to Data Sources (via parent_source)
- Data Sources are nested in Databases

2. Items/rows within a database data source

For pages in databases, properties should match the data source schema.

    customer_index: Index of the customer in the customers list (0-based)
    line_items: List of line items (products and quantities)
    financial_status: Order financial status (pending, paid, refunded, etc.)

ShopifyOrderLineItem.title: ShopifyOrderLineItem
ShopifyOrderLineItem.description:
Line item for a Shopify order.

Attributes:
    product_index: Index of the product in the products list (0-based)
    quantity: Quantity of the product to order

ShopifyProduct.title: ShopifyProduct
ShopifyProduct.description:
Simplified Shopify product data.

Single-variant products are supported directly with price/sku/stock fields.
For multi-variant products, use the implementation's API directly.

Attributes:
    title: Product name
    description: Product description (plain text or HTML)
    vendor: Brand or vendor name
    category: Product category/type
    price: Product price as string (e.g., '29.99')
    sku: Stock Keeping Unit identifier
    stock: Available inventory count
    status: Product status (active, draft, archived)
